bioghist.p: John W. Claghorn was a merchant and auctioneer in Boston, Massachusetts, and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He was associated with the Boston firm of William Prentiss & Son, circa 1814; and with the Philadelphia firms of Jennings, Thomas Grill & Co.; Jennings and Thomas (all before 1835); and Myers and Claghorn, 1836-1840. His wife was Elizabeth Crumby of Boston.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of professional and personal papers of John W. Claghorn. Materials in the collection include business papers, bills and receipts, and correspondence. There are also family letters addressed to his wife, Elizabeth, and to their son, William C. Claghorn. Additional correspondents include James Lawrence Claghorn, A. Norcross and Co., William Prentiss, and Henry Reese.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
